intro: Peckoltia pedalis, commonly known as the red-tailed tetra, is a small freshwater fish native to South America. It belongs to the family Lebiasinidae and is characterized by its distinctive red coloration on the dorsal and caudal fins. The species is often found in slow-moving streams and rivers with dense vegetation. Its body shape is streamlined, and it has a laterally compressed body typical of many tetras. Peckoltia pedalis is popular in the aquarium trade due to its vibrant colors and peaceful temperament.
